body.p: If a right of set‑off cannot be enforced in the event of default and in the event of insolvency or bankruptcy, then offsetting would not reflect the economic substance of the entity’s rights and obligations and would therefore not meet the objective of offsetting in paragraph 43 of IAS 32. The Board uses the term ‘in the event of default and in the event of insolvency or bankruptcy’ to describe scenarios where an entity will not or cannot perform under the contract.
